title: urban ink
content:
First font, I'm an aspiring graphic design student. This was a project I plan on expanding more, so any and all critique is awesome!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [urbanink\_3\_17\_10.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417132908/http:/typophile.com/files/urbanink_3_17_10.pdf) | 165.36 KB |
author: ishbog

comments.content:
lowercase 'o' could use some overshoot  
uppercase 'R' needs some weight and width  
uppercase 'W' could lose some weight

Obviously not a text font, so your quirkiness could be more pronounced.  
Why not be more daring?

By the way, I would like to mention that I had no idea what I was doing going into this, as my typography teacher is really just a graphic designer who provided zero material on the actual creation of a font, and when asked about some basic type elements I've learned here, said there were no guidelines for creating a typeface. \*facepalm\*
